question:
With reference to the recent unveiling of the statue of Bhakta Ramadasu in Telangana, consider the following statements:
  1. He is a Carnatic musician from the 19th
  2. His work Dasarathi Shatakamu was dedicated to Lord Ram.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Bhakta Ramadasu was a Carnatic composer (Vaggeyakara) from the 17th century. He is also known by the names, Kancharla Gopanna or Badhrachala Ramadasu. A 11 foot statue made of bronze was unveiled in Telangana on occasion of his 387th birth anniversary. Statement 2 is correct:       One of his noted work is Dasarathi Shatakamu which is dedicated to Lord Ram. It is a collection of 108 poems written in Telugu and dedicated to the ‘son of Dasaratha’. Ramadasu is a noted devotee of Lord Ram.
